meanings.definition: In relation to editing or the work of an editor.
meanings.sent1: The editorially approved article was well-written.
meanings.sent2: She received editorially feedback on her writing.
meanings.sent3: The editorially polished manuscript shone brightly.
meanings.sent4: Her editorially skills were as sharp as a razor.
meanings.sent5: The editorially improved document was a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: In a manner characteristic of an editor.
meanings.sent1: She edited the document editorially before submission.
meanings.sent2: He spoke editorially about the importance of fact-checking.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked editorially across the keyboard, pretending to edit.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scanned the page editorially, searching for errors.
meanings.sent5: The teacher marked the paper editorially, correcting mistakes.

meanings.definition: In a way that involves editing or editorial work.
meanings.sent1: The article was revised editorially for accuracy.
meanings.sent2: They worked editorially to finalize the publication.
meanings.sent3: The dog barked editorially at the misspelled words on the screen.
meanings.sent4: Her mind raced editorially, thinking of ways to improve the text.
meanings.sent5: The team collaborated editorially to produce a flawless report.
